p: Surveillance is critical to inform infectious disease management and control programmes ( Klepac et al., 2013 ; Molyneux et al., 2004 ) and genomic data is emerging as a powerful new surveillance tool ( Cotton et al., 2018 ). Pathogen sequencing has become increasingly routine in well-resourced public health laboratories, but in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) where most emerging and endemic zoonoses occur, sequencing capacity is more limited and the direct application of genomics-informed surveillance is still at an early stage ( Balloux et al., 2018 ; Folarin et al., 2014 ; Gardy & Loman, 2018).
